abstract.p: Board of Public Utilities, responding to wholesale price increase, approves natural gas hike that will affect two million New Jersey residents; graphs (S)

block.p: Natural gas costs will increase for more than two million New Jersey residents under new rates approved by the Board of Public Utilities last week. The increases are a response to the 50 percent rise in wholesale natural gas prices since last summer. Public Service Electric & Gas, which serves more than 1.6 million customers, and New Jersey Natural Gas, with 400,000 customers, will increase gas costs this winter by 16 percent. Elizabethtown Gas Company's 250,000 customers will see a 17.3 percent increase. If wholesale prices continue to rise, the three companies will be permitted to increase rates by 2 percent each month from December to April.
